instruction: Compare and contrast the characteristics of two Android operating systems
output: Android 9.0 (Pie) and Android 10.0 (Q) are two versions of the Android operating system, released in 2018 and 2019 respectively. Both operating systems feature an improved user interface and enhanced security features, but Android 10.0 (Q) adds new features such as gesture navigation, dark mode, support for foldable and 5G devices, improved privacy settings, and more. In addition, Android 10.0 (Q) allows users to customize their settings and provides more customization options. Meanwhile, Android 9.0 (Pie) features features like Adaptive Battery, which optimizes battery life and Digital Wellbeing, which helps users stay in control of their time. In terms of performance, Android 10.0 (Q) is faster than Android 9.0 (Pie). Android 10.0 (Q) also features a new permission system that greatly enhances its efficiency and security.
